memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.” (Psalm 119:105)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Every believer’s life is a spiritual journey. God has graciously given us a divine navigation system  His GPS (God’s Positional System)  the guidance of the Holy Spirit, who directs our steps with perfect accuracy.

But Satan, like a hacker performing GPS Spoofing, sends false spiritual signals to confuse and mislead believers. In the cyber world, GPS spoofing is a malicious attack that causes devices to display the wrong location, direction, and timing  leading to disaster. Likewise, the enemy attacks our thoughts and spirit, giving us wrong feelings, false revelations, and deceptive desires.

Adam and David both lost direction for a while. Even Jesus was tempted by Satan  but He triumphed through the Word of God.

When prayer, the Word, and spiritual alertness are weakened, our navigation drifts off course. So, be vigilant in prayer, steadfast in faith, and obedient in your walk. Let your feet stand firm upon the Rock of Ages  Jesus Christ, and be guided by His eternal Word and the Holy Spirit.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “The safest place in the world is to be in the center of God’s will.”( Corrie Ten Boom )

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, make my ears sensitive to Your voice alone. Protect me from the confusion of the enemy. Let Your Word guide my path and keep me firm in faith. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: Be led by the Spirit, not by emotions.
If you walk in faith, you will never lose your way.
